subject: Re: Alternative Option for Private Methods Testing
msgSnippet: Thank you David. I m then going to submit a pull request along these lines: If you are using JDK 1.3 or higher, you can use Java s Reflection API to subvert
messageBody:
Thank you David. I'm then going to submit a pull request along these lines:

If you are using JDK 1.3 or higher, you can use Java's Reflection API to subvert the access control mechanism. For help writing the necessary reflection code you can use the PrivateAccessor wrapper library, or dp4j annotation's processor for automatically injecting reflection in your test.
For details on how to use PrivateAccessor, read this article. To see Dp4j in action, download this script or this demo project.
